result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI Cause Injury (3rd) and PAC Cause Injury (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI Cause Injury (3rd) and the other charge, PAC Cause Injury (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Eric Herman Voss was found guilty of OWI Cause Injury (3rd), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Report to probation department here today, may be transferred to Oneida County
*Complete an Alcohol/Drug Assessment or Department of Transportation Driver Safety Plan and comply with any recommendations.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay fine/costs
*Bond in 15CF429 to be applied to restitution/fine/costs 
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
*Pay restitution to A. W. - to be taken from bond and paid first
*Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.  If Defendant is going to school, must work part-time while going to school.
*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
*AODA & comply with treatment recommendations, if has not had one within the past 9 months

*Continue with current treatment program Defendant is in and continue with prescriptions
*Maintain absolute sobriety
*Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
*No contact with victim A.W.

timeConds.notes:
*Huber granted for employment and any counseling defendant may be involved in
*May serve jail in Oneida County 
*3 day furlows once a month so Defendant can attend weekend duties in the Army Reserves
*Report to jail here today, sentence to commence within the first 30 days from today's date

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Eric Herman Voss in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CF-429, 16CF-100, 16CF-101 and 16CF-225.

9:25 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Matters are set for a plea today.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, 16CF-225 is set for a preliminary examination.
Defendant wishes to waive the preliminary examination and enter a plea of NOT GUILTY.
State will dismiss and read in this case. 

15CF-429: Defendant will plead to Count 1. Count 2 would be dismissed.

16CF-100 and 16CF-101 would be dismissed and read in as part of the agreement.

Parties wish to proceed without a PSI.

Victim is present and would like to make a statement today.

Atty McFarland concurs with plea agreement.

16CF-225:
Court addresses this case.
Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.
Court explains a preliminary hearing to Defendant.
Defendant states he understands what a preliminary hearing is.
Court questions Defendant on his waiver of preliminary hearing.
Court questions Atty McFarland.
Court finds Defendant is freely, voluntarily, intelligently and knowingly waiving his right to preliminary hearing.
Court finds probable cause that a crime was committed and Defendant committed it.
Case is bound over.
Atty McFarland has received a copy of the information, has reviewed it with his client and enters pleas of NOT GUILTY.

Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties in 15CF-429.

Plea Questionairre/Waiver of Rights is filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1 15CF-429.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney McFarland for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.
Atty McFarland acknowledges previous OWI convictions.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF-429: Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein OWI causing injury 3rd offense
15CF-429: Count 2: Dismissed
16CF-100: Dismissed and Read In
16CF-101: Dismissed and Read In
16CF-225: Dismissed and Read In

9:37 AM A.W. addresses the Court, makes a statement.
Court questions Victim for clarifications.
Court thanks Victim for being here today.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland presents to the Court proof of treatment that Defendant voluntarily went to.

Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.
Court addresses the parties. Court thanks victim for being here.

BY THE COURT:
15CF-429:
Count 1:
Sentence is Withheld
Placed on Probation for a period of 24 Months
Conditions:
Jail sentence for 6 Months
5 days jail credit
Huber granted for employment and any counseling Defendant may be involved in
May serve jail in Oneida County
3 day furlows once a month so Defendant can attend weekend duties in the army reserves
Report to probation department here today, may be transferred to Oneida County
Report to jail here today, sentence to commence within the first 30 days from today's date
AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations if not had one within the past 9 months.  BAC: .28
Continue with current treatment program Defendant is in and continue with prescriptions 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Maintain absolute sobriety
Obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or a combination of both to equal full time. If Defendant is going to school, must work part time while going to school.
Participate with other counseling as recommended by the agent
Pay restitution of  $520.30 - to be taken from bond and be paid first
Pay fine and costs totaling $4,460
Pay blood draw fee of $26.45
DL Revoked for 36 Months
IID for 36 Months
DOT Assessment and comply with safety plan
No contact with victim A.W.

16CF-100 - cash bond to be applied to restitution/fine/costs in 15CF-429
Bond in 15CF-429 to be applied to restitution/fine/costs

20 days in which to appeal the case.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 23, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on April 11, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on March 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference at 02-29-2016 10:00 am
filed by ADA DK
for Defendant
Pre-trial conference at 01-25-2016 09:30 am

3:22 case is recalled:  Defendant Eric Herman Voss in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. ADA Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant wishes to proceed today by waiving his preliminary hearing.   Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
Arraignment: 
  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Parties rescheduled.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing at 12-07-2015 03:00 pm

Defendant Eric Herman Voss in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:13 AM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Address is verified.

Atty Mcfarland received a copy of the complaint, waives reading, requests preliminary hearing and waives time limits for that hearing.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is continued.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Erik McFarland
Portage County Community Justice Program Court Referral Form

ADA David Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of OWI 3rd offense.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
Defendant makes statements he thought an attorney would be here today. 
State requests a $1,000 cash bond with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  11/23/2015  @ 9:00 a.m.  in Branch 3

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Do not operate a vehicle unless absolutely sober.
Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  *On all days he is scheduled for Court.
